'''John Patrick Greco, Jr.''' (born March 24, 1985) is an [[American football]] [[guard (American and Canadian football)|guard]] for the [[Cleveland Browns]] of the [[National Football League]] (NFL). He was selected in the third round of the [[2008 NFL draft]] by the [[St. Louis Rams]]. He played [[college football]] at the [[University of Toledo]].

==Early years==
Greco was named First-team All-Conference and Second-team All-region as a senior and was Second-team All-Conference as a junior at [[Boardman High School (Mahoning County, Ohio)|Boardman High School]] in Youngstown, Ohio.

==College career==
He was a three-time All-[[Mid-American Conference|MAC]] honoree at left tackle. As a freshman, in 2004, he started at right tackle. In college, he allowed 6.5 sacks in two years. He started 36 games and recorded 275 knockdowns and 34 touchdown-resulting blocks during his three seasons at left tackle. In 2007, he started all 12 games for Toledo and earned First-team All-MAC for the third consecutive season and was a Third-team [[All-America]] by [[Rivals.com]] after allowing only three sacks on 411 pass plays. As a junior in 2006 he was the team co-captain started all 13 games at left tackle, earning First-team All-MAC honors.
As a sophomore in 2005 Greco was First-team All-MAC in his first season at left tackle. He took over left tackle position after graduation of [[Nick Kaczur]]. He opened holes for an offense that ranked 13th in the nation in rushing (216.8 yards per game) and 10th in scoring (25.8 points per game). As a freshman in 2004 he started all 13 games at right tackle and earned the team's top freshman award. He redshirted as a true freshman in 2003.

==Professional career==
Greco was one of the strongest offensive linemen in the [[2008 NFL Draft]]. He bench pressed 420 pounds and leg pressed 1,050 pounds.

===St. Louis Rams===
Greco was selected 65th overall in the third round for the [[St. Louis Rams]] in the 2008 NFL Draft.  On June 12, 2008, Greco signed a three-year, $1.794 million contract with the Rams, with the  deal including a $644,000 signing bonus. He spent 2008 as a backup; due to injuries he started one game at the end of the [[2008 NFL season]].

===Cleveland Browns===
After three seasons in St. Louis, the Rams traded Greco to the [[Cleveland Browns]] for a conditional seventh round draft pick in the 2012 NFL draft on July 31, 2011.<ref>{{cite web|date=July 31, 2011|work=ESPN.com|url=http://espn.go.com/blog/nfcwest/post/_/id/41743/greco-trade-and-overhauling-rams-front|title=Greco trade and overhauling Rams' front|first=Mike|last=Sando|accessdate=March 25, 2016}}</ref>  Greco started 12 games in the 2012 season, after an injury to [[Jason Pinkston]]. He played very well, finishing among the highest ranked guards in the league for blocking percentage. 

On July 23, 2013, Greco signed a five-year contract extension with the Browns, worth a maximum of $13 million with $3 million guaranteed.<ref>{{cite web|last=Miniel|first=David|title=Cleveland Browns sign Guard John Greco|url=http://fansided.com/2013/07/24/cleveland-browns-sign-guard-john-greco/#!LOc8P|publisher=SI.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|work=NFL.com|url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap1000000220028/article/john-greco-cleveland-browns-agree-to-extension|title=John Greco, Cleveland Browns agree to extension|first=Marc|last=Sessler|date= July 23, 2013|accessdate=March 25, 2016}}</ref> On October 12, 2014, Greco played at center for the first time of his career after [[Alex Mack]] left due to a broken fibula.

Greco would miss the last two games of the [[2015 Cleveland Browns season|2015 season]] due to spraining one of his [[Medial collateral ligament|MCLs]].<ref>{{cite web|work=ESPN.com|url=http://espn.go.com/espn/wire?section=nfl&id=14416927|title=Browns guard John Greco done for season with knee injury|date=December 21, 2015|accessdate=March 25, 2016}}</ref>
